com.apriori.concurrent

Class ActorThreadPool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.ActorThreadPool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of actor with which each task is associated
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SerializingExecutor<T>

    public class ActorThreadPool<T>
extends Object
implements SerializingExecutor<T>
    A thread pool that runs multiple sequential streams. Each stream can be considered a series of tasks associated with an actor. All tasks for an actor are executed sequentially. Parallelism is achieved by running tasks for multiple actors, each actor's stream being independent and running concurrently.

    This thread pool uses multiple work queues (one per actor) and work stealing. A given actor is pinned to a thread in the pool. But if that thread gets busy processing tasks for other actors, a different (idle) thread in the pool can "steal" that actor, thus pinning the actor to a new thread.

    Pinning actors to threads can help with cache performance and locality of reference. Allowing other threads to steal actors helps with fairness and can improve throughput.

    This is similar in functionality to a PipeliningExecutorService, which wraps another executor instead of providing its own thread pool. Because it does not control the way the executor dispatches tasks to actual threads, it does neither thread-pinning nor work-stealing.

    The definitions for "core" and "maximum" pool sizes differ a bit from ThreadPoolExecutor. The core pool consists of the threads that aren't ever allowed to expire. They are kept alive until the executor terminates. The maximum pool size is the peak size allowed in cases of where the number of concurrent active actors exceeds the size of the core pool. A ThreadPoolExecutor only adds threads beyond the core pool size when its work queue is full. However, this executor uses unbounded queues, one per actor. It adds threads beyond the core pool size whenever an actor is added but all existing threads are busy with previously submitted tasks for other actors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActorThreadPool

        public ActorThreadPool(int corePoolSize,
                       int maximumPoolSize)
        Creates a new thread pool with the given size. Idle threads are retained for 30 seconds before terminating. Threads are created using a default thread factory.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the size of the core pool
        maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads allowed in the pool

      • ActorThreadPool

        public ActorThreadPool(int corePoolSize,
                       int maximumPoolSize,
                       long keepAliveTime,
                       TimeUnit unit)
        Creates a new thread pool with the given size and keep-alive time. Threads are created using a default thread factory.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the size of the core pool
        maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads allowed in the pool
        keepAliveTime - the duration for which an idle thread is retained
        unit - the unit for the keep-alive time

      • ActorThreadPool

        public ActorThreadPool(int corePoolSize,
                       int maximumPoolSize,
                       long keepAliveTime,
                       TimeUnit unit,
                       ThreadFactory threadFactory)
        Creates a new thread pool with the given size, keep-alive time, and thread factory.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the size of the core pool
        maximumPoolSize - the maximum number of threads allowed in the pool
        keepAliveTime - the duration for which an idle thread is retained
        unit - the unit for the keep-alive time
        threadFactory - the factory used to create worker threads

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(T t,
                    Runnable task)
        Specified by:
        execute in interface SerializingExecutor<T>

      • prestartCoreThread

        public boolean prestartCoreThread()
        Starts an idle core thread. If the core pool has already been filled with worker threads then no action is taken.
        Returns:
        true if a worker thread was created or false if the core pool is already full

      • prestartAllCoreThreads

        public int prestartAllCoreThreads()
        Starts all core threads in an idle state. Core threads are typically created lazily, as new actor tasks are submitted to the pool. This can be used to start all of them. If the core pool has already been filled then no new worker threads will be created.
        Returns:
        the number of worker threads created, possibly zero

      • getCorePoolSize

        public int getCorePoolSize()
        Returns the size of the core pool of worker threads. The actual number of threads in the pool may be fewer since worker threads are created lazily as new actor tasks are submitted.
        Returns:
        the size of the core pool

      • setCorePoolSize

        public void setCorePoolSize(int corePoolSize)
        Changes the size of the core pool of worker threads. This may also update the maximum pool size since the maximum must always be greater than or equal to the core pool size. If the new size is less than the previous value, idle worker threads will be allowed to terminate. If the new size is greater than the previous value, new core pool threads may be created to ensure that all active actors have a worker thread but without exceeding the new core pool size.
        Parameters:
        corePoolSize - the new size of the core pool

      • getMaximumPoolSize

        public int getMaximumPoolSize()
        Returns the maximum size for the pool of worker threads. The number of threads will not be allowed to exceed this value.
        Returns:
        the maximum size for the pool

      • setMaximumPoolSize

        public void setMaximumPoolSize(int maximumPoolSize)
        Sets the maximum size for the pool of worker threads. This value cannot be set to a number smaller than the core pool size. If the new size is smaller than the previous size, the pool of threads may exceed this value until worker threads complete their current task and then terminate to comply with the new maximum.
        Parameters:
        maximumPoolSize - the new maximum size for the pool

      • getKeepAliveTime

        public long getKeepAliveTime(TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the duration for which idle (non-core) worker threads are kept alive.
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit of the returned value
        Returns:
        the duration for which idle threads are kept alive

      • setKeepAliveTime

        public void setKeepAliveTime(long keepAliveTime,
                             TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the duration for which idle (non-core) worker threads are kept alive.
        Parameters:
        keepAliveTime -
        unit -

      • getActiveCount

        public int getActiveCount()
        Returns the count of active worker threads. This does not include idle threads in the pool, only threads that are actively processing a task.
        Returns:
        the count of active worker threads

      • getStealCount

        public long getStealCount()
        Returns the total number of times that an idle worker has stolen an actor from another busy worker.
        Returns:
        the total number of times that a thread has stolen work from another

      • getTaskCount

        public long getTaskCount()
        Returns the total number of tasks submitted to this executor. This includes queued tasks that have not yet begun.
        Returns:
        the total number of tasks submitted to this executor

      • getCompletedTaskCount

        public long getCompletedTaskCount()
        Returns the total number of tasks completed by this executor. This includes tasks that were cancelled.
        Returns:
        the total number of tasks completed by this executor

      • getLargestPoolSize

        public int getLargestPoolSize()
        Returns the largest observed size of the thread pool.
        Returns:
        the largest observed size of the thread pool

      • getCurrentPoolSize

        public int getCurrentPoolSize()
        Returns the current size of the thread pool. This includes both active and idle workers.
        Returns:
        the current size of the thread pool

      • getThreadFactory

        public ThreadFactory getThreadFactory()
        Returns the factory used to create worker threads.
        Returns:
        the factory used to create worker threads

      • setThreadFactory

        public void setThreadFactory(ThreadFactory threadFactory)
        Sets the factory used to create worker threads. This has no impact on threads already created. Existing threads are retained. The new factory will only be used in the event that new threads are added to the pool.
        Parameters:
        threadFactory - the new factory used to create worker threads

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the executor. No new tasks will be accepted. Attempts to submit tasks after this will result in RejectedExecutionExceptions. This starts the termination process.

        If the executor has already been shutdown then this has no effect.

      • shutdownNow

        public List<Runnable> shutdownNow()
        Shuts down the executor immediately, interrupting in-process tasks and removing all queued tasks. No new tasks will be accepted. Attempts to submit tasks after this will result in RejectedExecutionExceptions.

        If the executor has already been shutdown then this has no effect and an empty list of removed tasks is returned.

        Returns:
        the list of removed tasks that were queued but never executed

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Returns true if this executor is shutdown. A shutdown executor does not accept any new tasks. But it may continue processing already-queued tasks. When the executor is both shutdown and has completed all tasks, then it has terminated.
        Returns:
        true if this executor is shutdown; false if it is still accepting tasks

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Returns true if this executor is terminated. The executor is terminated after a call to shutdown() or shutdownNow() once all worker threads terminate.
        Returns:
        true if this executor is terminated

      • isTerminating

        public boolean isTerminating()
        Returns true if this executor is in the process of terminating. This is the state after a call to shutdown() or shutdownNow() but before all worker threads have finished. While terminating, the executor is waiting on in-progress and queued tasks to complete.
        Returns:
        true if this executor is in the process of terminating

      • awaitTermination

        public boolean awaitTermination(long timeLimit,
                                TimeUnit unit)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Blocks until this executor has finished terminating. If the executor is already terminated then this returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - the limit of time to wait
        unit - the unit for the time limit
        Returns:
        true if the executor terminated or false if the time limit elapsed first
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting
